summary: Medicaid paid $171 billion—about half its total 2017 federal expenditures—to managed care organizations. The Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services estimated that about 0.3% of that amount were improper payments. For the entire Medicaid program, CMS estimated about 10% of payments were improper, which led us to question the managed care rate. We examined state and federal reviews of managed care and the estimating method...
title: Medicaid: CMS Should Take Steps to Mitigate Program Risks in Managed Care
